document.docTitle: Mimetus subulatus Liu & Xu & Hormiga & Yin 2021, new species
document.masterDocTitle: New species of the pirate spider genus Mimetus Hentz, 1832 from China with a cladistic hypothesis on their phylogenetic placement (Araneae, Mimetidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype :
♂ (Mime-0121- HNU ): China , Guangdong Province : Shaoguan City , Ruyuan County ,
Nanling National Forest Park
, Rufeng Ropeway Station , forest, 24°57.97'N , 113°02.84'E ,
1453m
,
26.VII.2016
, Haiqiang Yin , Tieyang Zhou , Guchun Zhou , Chaomin Li , Ailan He , Wang Liu , Jinxin Liu , Zhuo’er Chen and Chen Zeng leg.

1♂ 1♀ (Mime-0113- HNU , Mime-0123- HNU ): almost same data as holotype except the slightly different collecting spot and collecting time, Nanling National Forest Park, Waterfall , 24°53.60'N , 113°02.34'E ,
940m
,
27.VII.2016
;
2♀ (Mime-0114- HNU , Mime-0115- HNU ): almost same data as holotype except the slightly different collecting spot and collecting time, Nanling National Forest Park, Shifeiling , 24°53.77'N , 113°02.34'E ,
1570m
,
28.VII.2016
;
1♀ (Mime-0099- HNU ): almost same data as holotype except the slightly dif- ferent collecting spot and collecting time, Nanling National Forest Park, Baimakeng ; 24°52.41'N , 113°01.53'E ,
1190m
,
29.VII.2016
;
1♂ (Mime-0103- HNU ): China , Hunan Province : Chenzhou City , Mangshan Nature Reserves , Zeziping , forest, 24°57.34'N , 112°57.67'E ,
502m
,
22.VIII.2014
, Haiqiang Yin , Xiang Xu , Cheng Wang , Bing Zhou , Jiahui Gan , Yuhui Gong , Hao Fang and Junxiong Fang leg
;
1♂ 1♀ (Mime-0035- HNU , Mime-0036- HNU ): China , Guangdong Province : Shaoguan City , Danxiashan Mountain National Geological Park , Xianglonghu , 25°1.51'N , 113°44.28'E ,
180m
,
8.VIII.2019
, Ailan He , Qu Cai , Huijuan Sheng , Shixiong Zhu , Jiabin Liu leg
;
2♀ (Mime-0037- HNU , Mime-0038- HNU ): China , Guangdong Province : Shaoguan City , Danxiashan Mountain National Geological Park , Bamboo forest , 25°8.5'N , 113°44.35'E ,
201m
,
6.VIII.2019
, Ailan He , Qu Cai , Huijuan Sheng , Shixiong Zhu , Jiabin Liu leg.
Etymology. The specific name is derived from the Latin word for awl ( subula ) in reference to the awl-shaped subtegular apophysis.

Diagnosis. The male of
Mimetus subulatus
n. sp.
differs from those of all other
Mimetus species
by the awlshaped subtegular apophysis and the short tibia which is almost equal to, or is at least not much longer than, the cymbium ( Figs 4G, H , 7C, D ). The female of
M. subulatus
n. sp.
is similar to that of
M. niveosignatus
n. sp.
but differs by the middle chambers of the spermathecae being longer than the lateral ones (to the contrary in
M . niveosignatus
) (compare Figs 6C, D , 8B and Figs 17E , 19B ).

Description. Male ( Holotype ). Habitus as in Fig. 4A . Total length 2.14. Carapace 0.99 long, 0.86 wide. Opisthosoma 1.22 long, 1.25 wide. Sternum 0.55 long and 0.47 wide. Labium wider than long. Clypeus height 0.18. Eye sizes and interdistances: AME 0.10, ALE 0.08, PME 0.09, PLE 0.08, AME–AME 0.03, ALE–AME 0.04, PME–PME 0.04, PME–PLE 0.05. MOA 0.09 long, anterior width 0.04, posterior width 0.06. Leg measurements see Table 1 .

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Appendage measurements of
Mimetus subulatus
male (holotype)

FIGURE 3. SEMs of male palp (holotype), frontolateral view A , B ,
Mimetus subulatus
n. sp.
; C , D ,
Mimetus uncatus
n. sp.
Abbreviations: STA = subtegular apophysis, PCP = pilose cuticular projections. Scale bars: A, 0.1mm; B–D, 0.02mm

subSubSection.paragraph: Abdomen ( Fig. 4A, D ): deep brown, approximately tetrahedral, as long as wide, widest in the medial region; dorsum covered irregularly with many whitish dots.

Pedipalp ( Figs 4E–H , 7A–D ): tibia approximately as long as cymbium, slightly swollen distally, with a few long macrosetae. Cymbium with many especially long setae dorsally, with apex strongly extended to form a bowlshaped outgrowth. Paracymbium broad, triangular. Subtegular apophysis long and sharp, awl-shaped. Sclerotized area of conductor complex, whorled and rolls up to form several apophyses including one protecting the apical end of embolus. Tip of membranous area of conductor with pilose cuticular projections ( Fig. 3B ). Embolus tubular, strongly curved around the membranous area of conductor and forming ca. 3/4 circle, proximally swollen.

Female ( Paratype , Mime-0123-HNU). Similar to male in general features; more prominent blackish spots than male ( Fig. 5A ). Total length 2.28; Prosoma 0.95 long, 0.79 wide; Abdomen 1.27 long, 1.34 wide. Sternum 0.50 long, 0.48 wide. Labium wider than long. Clypeus 0.15 high. Eye sizes and interdistances: AME 0.09, ALE 0.08, PME 0.07, PLE 0.07, AME–AME 0.03, ALE–AME 0.05, PME–PME 0.05, PME–PLE 0.05. MOA anterior width 0.03, posterior width 0.05, length 0.07. Leg measurements see Table 2 .

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Appendage measurements of
Mimetus subulatus
female (paratype)

subSubSection.paragraph: Abdomen ( Fig. 5A–C ): Brown, interspersed by numerous dark-gray and white spots dorsally and ground color grey.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 6.
Mimetus subulatus
n. sp.
, epigynum of paratype. A , B , epigynum, ventral view; C , D , dorsal view; E , F , frontal view. Abbreviations: FD = fertilization ducts. Scale bars: A–F, 0.05mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Epigynum ( Figs 6 A–F , 8A, B ): atrium reduced, divided into two parts, with arc-shaped anterior margins. Basal plate sclerotized, twice as wide as long, slightly divided into two swollen parts ( Figs 6A , 8A ), with the posterior margin straight. Copulatory openings and copulatory ducts inconspicuous. Medial spermathecal chambers long oval, close to each other, lateral chambers spherical. Fertilization ducts lightly sclerotized, originating at the junction of the medial and the lateral spermathecal chambers. ( Fig. 6E, F ).
